intro: Seemannantha tenuis, commonly known as the slender seemannanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical in shape, with a smooth surface. Seemannantha tenuis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
